article: One hundred and thirteen million Americans have at least one bank-issued credit card. They give their owners automatic _ in stores, restaurants, and hotels, at home, across the country, and even abroad, and they make many banking services _ as well. More and more of those credit cards can be _ automatically, making _ possible to withdraw or _ money in scattered locations, whether or not the local branch bank is open, For many of us the "cashless society" is not _ ---- it' s already here. _ computers offer these conveniences to consumers, they have many _ for sellers too. Electronic cash registers can do much more than simply _ sales. They can keep a wide _ of records, including who sold what, when and to whom. This information allows businessmen to _ track of their list of goods _ showing which items are being sold and how fast they are moving. _ to reorder or return goods to suppliers can then be made. At the same time these computers record which _ are the busiest and which employees are the most efficient, allowing personnel and staffing assignments to be made _ . And they also _ preferred customers for promotional campaigns. Computers are relied on by manufacturers for _ reasons. Computer-analyzed marketing reports can help to decide which products to emphasize now, which to develop for the future and which to drop. Computers keep track of goods in _ , of raw materials _ hand, and even of the production process itself. Numerous other commercial enterprises, from theaters to magazine publishers, from gas and electric _ to milk processors, bring better and more efficient services to consumers through the use of computers.
